sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The president of the European Council, Charles Michel, has spoken by telephone to President Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He's trying to persuade Russia to agree to a truce in eastern Ukraine to facilitate humanitarian corridors, but so far he's been unsuccessful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In the besieged city of Mariupol in the south, Russian troops are reported to be in control.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The only resistance is coming from Ukrainian forces in a steel plant complex.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Russia says it will let civilians leave if they surrender.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: On the diplomatic front, negotiations appear to have stalled.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They have stalled now because another proposal that takes into account Ukraine's comments received earlier and that we handed over to Ukrainian negotiators five days ago remains unanswered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian president lamented Russia's refusal to a truce in the east for Orthodox Easter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And following comments by a Russian general, he repeated that Ukraine is only the beginning and that more states will be attacked by Moscow, referring, for example, to Moldova.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: New satellite images seem to confirm the discovery of a mass grave in Mariupol, and there are

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: reports from the northern city of Kharkiv that Russian shells continue to strike civilian structures, leaving dead and wounded victims and dozens of people homeless.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: However, Russia's main offensive is concentrated in the east, where Moscow's aim is to dominate and control the two regions of Donbas, where separatists have been fighting with Ukraine for eight years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As Russian forces draw closer, residents are attempting to flee, with Red Cross workers helping to evacuate the most vulnerable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Despite the continuing Russian attacks on Ukrainian territory, life in the capital Kiev has been returning to something like normal in recent weeks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Although the mayor's warning that the city is far from safe, more and more people are taking to the streets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Cafes, restaurants and other businesses are opening their doors to customers. Marina has just returned to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: MARINA, I think that Kyiv is coming back to life, because the days when we came back, it was looking like more empty city, but now it's looking like more people are coming back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: First, we have our luggages packed packed because we never know what will happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT, Marina's friend Anna has just started work again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: ANNA, Marina's friend Anna, One week ago, we opened our first business.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's a bakery. So we saw that people are coming to the city, and we have customers, we have guests, and we can work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We are delighted, really.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Most of the people returning are women and children, coming back not just to the place, but to the partners, husbands and grandparents that couldn't or wouldn't leave the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So many people want to come back that the bus connection with the Polish capital Warsaw has been re-established.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But you don't have to go too far from the city to find Ukrainian military teams diffusing mines and other explosive devices left by Russian forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's a grim reminder that this war is far from over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Fresh satellite pictures from Ukraine have revealed more rows of mass graves in Manhush, some 20 kilometres west of Mariupol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Officials say Russian soldiers have been transporting bodies for burial to the site which contains 200 new graves.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Ukrainian police and forensic scientists are collecting evidence outside Kyiv after experts accused Putin's military of looting, intimidating, torturing and killing civilians in the village of Barbutzia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: looting, intimidating, torturing and killing civilians in the village of Barbutzia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Over these eight weeks, international humanitarian law has not merely been ignored, but seemingly tossed aside. Russian armed forces have indiscriminately shelled and bombed populated areas, killing civilians and wrecking hospitals, schools and other civilian infrastructure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Actions that may amount to war crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: As investigations into potential war crimes continue, Euronews reporter Valeria Guria met with Ukraine's prosecutor general, who said the support of the courts is essential if Kyiv is to bring war criminals to trial.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We have 7,661 criminal cases only about war crimes and more than 3,000 cases which are connected with war crimes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: When we opened the mass graves with civilians, they were shattered.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Their arms were tied back their bodies. We have facts of sexual crimes against civilians, not only against women and even against men, children and old women.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And in Borodiyanka, north of the capital, the bodies of nine civilians, including that of a 15-year-old girl, were found in a shallow grave behind a local hospital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The chief of police for Kyiv says some individuals showed signs of torture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Yulia arrived in Serbia from Bucha, Ukraine, with her daughter and grandson in mid-March.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: They miss their family and homeland every day, but she says it is even harder during the Easter period.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Everything is fine here, but I want to be at home with my family now for the holiday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: What members of your family were left behind?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: My mother, father and my son.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Home to 60 refugees from Ukraine, Yulia and her family are trying to get into the festive spirit at the Vranje Asylum Centre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: YULIA, Vranya, Today we painted and decorated these eggs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: At home we do this on Good Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: We are far from home, but we like it here.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The children are happy to have the same customs as here, the same tradition, everything is the same.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's very nice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Now we're not at home, and in this place we're feeling happy because all our people are with us in this church, it's wonderful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Our people also suffered and fled, so we know your torment and trouble. And that is why we want your stay here to be as pleasant as possible.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: These refugee families will visit the museum and theatre in Vranje and the Prohorsynski monastery over the holidays.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: And on Easter Sunday they will attend mass followed by a special lunch in the Church of the Holy Trinity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Planting trees for peace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That was the aim of European parliamentarians in their visit to battle-scarred Bucha this Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This park for peace has been built on the site of the Bucha massacre, in which at least 500 Ukrainian civilians were killed by Russian armed forces.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But the mayor of the Ukrainian city urged Europe to do more now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: I understand that many rely on economic relations with Russia for the development of their countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But in Europe, in Ukraine, people are dying.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And all of Europe, countries of the European continent, must understand who they are dealing with.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: What Russia is doing is like Nazism.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The only way to get peace is through our victory, and given the scale of destruction, it will be very difficult for us to rebuild on our own.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The fact is the Russian aggressor threw us back decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: aggressor with kino Nazar the presence of European parliamentarians in Bucha is welcomed by the mayor of the city but as he insisted and as all Ukrainians I've met these days have been saying signs of goodwill and declarations of intent are just not enough, they say, to save Ukraine and indeed the rest of Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Vahri Goria from Butcha for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In Somalia, at least eight people died and 13 were injured on Friday

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: in a blast at a beachside restaurant in the capital Mogadishu.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The country's police chief was in the restaurant at the time, along with a group of lawmakers, according to the ambulance service.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The officials were unharmed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The explosion came days after a mortar attack targeted Somalia's parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Portuguese prosecutors have identified a formal suspect

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: in the disappearance of the British toddler Madeleine McCann.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The announcement comes 15 years after she went missing from her family's apartment in Portugal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The long-lasting investigation spread across Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It became world famous after her parents turned to the media for help to locate her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: German authorities named Christian Buckner as a suspect in the case. He is currently imprisoned for raping a woman in the area where the toddler originally went missing. He is the first suspect to be named by authorities since 2007. The timing of this update falls just one month ahead of the 15-year anniversary of the disappearance, which is the statute of limitations for similar crimes in Portugal.
